New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers extend their win streak to 12
Key Match Events: Allen dove into the courtside seats to rebound Barnes' missed turnaround with 1:02 remaining
Garland followed with a 3-pointer that extended the Cavaliers' lead to 129-124
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Kenny Atkinson said wrapping up a back-to-back set against the Raptors was 'a perfect trap game'
Post-Match Reflections: Cavaliers are tied for the fifth-best record in league history through 37 games at 33-4
Cleveland also has the top home mark in the NBA, going 20-1 at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boucher and rookie Jamal Shead combined to make 12 of their first 13 shots, including all eight 3-pointers, as Toronto built a 93-81 lead midway through the third quarter
Center Allen and power forward Mobley made 15 of their 20 field goal attempts, continuing to bolster their case for being chosen to the Eastern Conference All-Star team
Others: The Cavaliers' players didn't take the message to heart until the final quarter, when they outscored Toronto 34-23
